page.title: 14METHODIST CHURCH & POST OFF:
page.content: THE WESLEYAN METHODIST CHAPEL built in 1896, costing Â£1026.10.3d, replaced an earlier Wesleyan Chapel. It is in Mkt. Rasen & Caistor Circuit comprising 16 Churches covered by 2 Ministers and Local Preachers. Service held every week at Ludford _ congregation about 8 or 10, in line with today's low attend _ances for most denomimations. Once there was a Sunday School of 100 child _ren here. Miss K Martin Organist for 63 years _ wonderful service. Doctor's Surgery in Church room one day a week. POST OFFICE _ with its General Store is important amenity, supplying a wide range of goods and paying out State Pensions & Benefits. In 1985 with rumours that small Post Offices might close, Parish Council made strong representations to Government to ensure this service, so vital to this small rural communiyy, remains.
